#Telescopes
2 basic types: refractors & reflectors
Refractors use lenses to focus light
Reflectors use mirrors

Largest refracting telescope: Yerkes (40") in ?New Zealand?
Largest reflecting telescope: Gran Telescopio Canarias (10.4 m)

Things telescopes can do:
1. Brighten an object (Light Collection Power (LCP))
2. Enhance visible details (Resolution)
3. Magnify an image

Magnification is pretty important

$LCP \propto r^2$ because it depends on the area of the telescope

Want smaller resolution
$\theta \propto \frac{\lambda}{d}$
